channel.title: Need Someone Who Knows The Compilers!
channel.description: I have tried editing my compiler code many times and never got it to work. Tried downloading different sources and no succes with compiling. My Path to my JDK Javac is C:\Sun\SDK\jdk\bin\javac.exe So incorporate that if you can help :C

item.title: Need Someone Who Knows The Compilers!
item.dc:creator: @shaza shaza
item.description:
@shaza wrote:

Go to start then my computer then your local disk

Then click on the programs files now look for java then open the file and it should
have a file with the jdk version behind it now go to your source and right clik on run
then edit now if the version behind jdk

@echo off
@echo server loading please wait…
cd …/build
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\java.exe” net/com/espeon/Server 43594
pause
exit

So say if yours is 1.6.0_11 put it behind it after that save as and clik run…

It should work

Read full topic
item.source: Need Someone Who Knows The Compilers!

item.title: Need Someone Who Knows The Compilers!
item.dc:creator: @AsianTony4 AsianTony4
item.description:
@AsianTony4 wrote:

Ok lets see if i can help you.

1st. Right click on ur compiler and click on edit. Then add this to it

@echo off title Server Compiler "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.6.0_03injavac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

were is says 03 replace it with ur current version of java.

2nd.

For the variable CLASSPATH in ur environmental settings set this as the variable value CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
replace the 07 with ur current version of java.

3rd. For the variable PATH in ur environmental settings set this as the variable value C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin
replace the 07 with ur current version of java.

Hopefully what i wrote is understandable and solves ur problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Need Someone Who Knows The Compilers!
